page.title: 05History from 1895 to present
page.content: In 1895 Seaton Sluice consisted of these places: Bottlework Square, Delaval Street, Market Place, Long Street, Short Street, Hussey Street, Sandy Island, Rocky Island. Children left school at 13 years old and started work at the pit, They worked at the pit at Seaton Sluice until 65 years old. Whilst they were at school the children had no games lessons, woodwork or metalwork, all the did was Maths, Reading, Writing and R.E. Due to the lack of sport after school hours all they did was play games like football, marbles, tops and whips, mount the cuddy and hoops. The old people have seen many changes in the Sluice including the bottleworks, harbour bridge, graffitti and most of all, the size of the village.
